Grain.Do: Warm, grounding grains like oats (1 cup cooked), quinoa (1 cup cooked), brown rice (1 cup cooked), barley (1 cup cooked). Focus on whole grains.
Grain.Dont: Light, cold, or dry grains like puffed rice, popcorn, excessively dry crackers. Limit refined flours and white bread.

Legume.Do: Warm, easily digestible legumes like moong dal (1 cup cooked), masoor dal (1 cup cooked), split peas (1 cup cooked). Ensure they are well-cooked and spiced.
Legume.Dont: Heavy, difficult to digest legumes like black beans, chickpeas in large quantities, or fermented beans. Avoid raw sprouts.

Veg.Do: Cooked, warm, and slightly oily vegetables like sweet potato (1 medium), carrots (1 cup cooked), zucchini (1 cup cooked), pumpkin (1 cup cooked), asparagus (1 cup cooked).
Veg.Dont: Raw, cold, bitter, or astringent vegetables like raw salads, bitter gourd in excess, cabbage, cauliflower, Brussels sprouts. Avoid watery vegetables like cucumber.

Spices.Do: Warming and digestive spices like ginger (small piece, fresh), black pepper (pinch), cumin (1/2 tsp), cardamom (1-2 pods), cinnamon (1/2 tsp), turmeric (1/2 tsp).
Spices.Dont: Cooling spices like coriander in excess, fennel. Avoid very pungent or overly stimulating spices that can aggravate Pitta or Vata.

Leafy veg.Do: Cooked leafy greens like spinach (1 cup cooked), methi (fenugreek leaves, 1 cup cooked), amaranth leaves (1 cup cooked). Ensure they are well-cooked and lightly spiced.
Leafy veg.Dont: Raw leafy greens. Avoid bitter and astringent greens like kale in large amounts.

Oil.Do: Warming and grounding oils like ghee (1-2 tsp), sesame oil (1-2 tsp), olive oil (1-2 tsp). Use in moderation for cooking.
Oil.Dont: Excessively light or cold oils. Avoid deep-frying.

Fruits.Do: Warm, sweet, and slightly tart fruits like cooked apples (1 medium), ripe bananas (1 medium), mangoes (1 cup, ripe and sweet), berries (1 cup, ripe).
Fruits.Dont: Very cold, watery, or astringent fruits like watermelon, cantaloupe, pomegranates, unripe fruits. Avoid large quantities of citrus fruits.

Nuts and Dry fruits.Do: Warm and nourishing nuts like almonds (soaked, 4-6 nuts), walnuts (2-3 pieces), dates (2-3 pieces).
Nuts and Dry fruits.Dont: Cold, heavy nuts. Avoid large quantities of cashews or pistachios, or dry nuts without soaking.

Milk product.Do: Warm, well-boiled milk (1 cup, spiced with cardamom or ginger), buttermilk (diluted and spiced, 1 cup), paneer (small portion, 50g).
Milk product.Dont: Cold milk, yogurt in excess, fermented dairy products, ice cream.

Condiments.Do: Warm and savory condiments like ginger pickle (small amount), lemon pickle (small amount), a pinch of rock salt.
Condiments.Dont: Very sour, spicy, or fermented condiments in excess. Avoid vinegar-based sauces.
